DOC.brief_summary: Neurally adjust ventilatory assist ( NAVA ) show improve patient- ventilator interaction reduce asynchrony . This short-term physiologic comparison PSV ( pressure support ventilation ) NAVA deliver noninvasive ventilation nasal cannula , premature infant postextubation . Patients undergo 30-min crossover trial noninvasive PSV NAVA , 15 minute . Diaphragm electrical activity ( EAdi ) airway pressure ( Paw ) record derive neural mechanical respiratory rate timing , inspiratory trigger delay time synchrony diaphragm contraction ventilator assistance , asynchrony index ( AI ) .
DOC.brief_title: Physiologic Comparison Between NIV-NAVA PS Preterm Infants
DOC.criteria: preterm infant le 32 week gestational age intubate 48 hour birth subject extubation minimal ventilator setting ( mean airway pressure < 7cmH2O + peak inspiratory pressure < 13 cmH2O + FiO2 < 0.4 + respiratory rate < 35/min ) inform consent parent major congenital anomaly use sedative anesthetic drug hemodynamic instability grade 3 high intraventricular hemorrhage phrenic nerve palsy
